intro: Pergularia tinctoria, commonly known as the red root or red root grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, which include anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. Pergularia tinctoria thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks.
